results.title: Bill
results.creator_credit: Anthony Page, Mel Stuart and Alan Landsburg Productions
results.brief_description: Bill, a 40 year old intellectually disabled man, must learn to survive the harsh realities of New York City or be recommitted to an institution for the rest of his life. He can neither read nor write and his child-like gentleness and innocence make him an easy target for hurt or rejection.

results.title: Bioncle: mask of light
results.creator_credit: David Molina, Terry Shakespeare, Sue Shakespeare, Miramax Films and The Lego Group
results.brief_description: CGI animated feature about robot creatures called Bionicles who live by a code of Unity, Duty and Destiny. ‘Chronicle’ finds a hidden mask that is the mask of light - he must take this mask to find his destiny which is to be the 7th Toa. A good versus evil battle evolves as light battles with the dark Master of Shadow in a bid to free the island home of Mata Nui from darkness. Made by the Lego Company and sure to be enjoyed by young purchasers of BionicleTM products. Direction and Art Direction by David Molina and Terry Shakespeare with a screenplay by Henry Gilroy.

results.title: Train the trainer : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Nine members of the general public in Melbourne tell their stories. These stories resonate deeply with the participants and, ultimately, are an expression of the creator’s identity.

results.title: Bighorn!
results.brief_description: Focuses on problems facing wildlife and wilderness areas in the United States. Gives the history of the Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep and describes its relationship to its environment. This film was made with the assistance of Yellowstone National Park, Glacier National Park and Grand Teton National Park.

results.title: Big yellow taxi
results.creator_credit: John Wilson and Fine Art Productions
results.brief_description: Joni Mitchell sings to an animated interpretation of her lyrics in this film with a clear environmental warning. Adam and Eve’s paradise is invaded by powerful road-making machinery that proceeds to tear down the vegetation and cover the earth with tar and cement.

results.title: The Pacific century. Faculty manual
results.creator_credit: Annenberg, CPB Project, PBI Productions and Westview Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Pacific century”.
To accompany The Pacific century telecourse. The Faculty manual consists of an overview, identification of points for emphasis, biographies, discussion topics, true/false questions, multiple choice questions and answer key.

results.title: Sentimental imperialists
results.creator_credit: Marc Levin, Al Levin, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program looks at American attitudes towards Asia, from 1776 to the present. This is the story of merchants, missionaries and U.S. marines who, however well-intentioned, often saw in Asia what they wanted to see, rather than what was really there. The episode focuses on China and the Philippines, where policies of cold calculation mingled with deep sentiment for the region continue to influence US relations with Asia.

results.title: Reinventing Japan
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program looks at the peculiar relationship between Japan and the United States that emerged in the wake of World War II. Set to the tunes of big band jazz and including footage of the period never before seen, “Reinventing Japan” captures the spirit of a strange era, full of idealism and democracy as well as bitter betrayals, when one country tried to reinvent another in its image - with surprising and unexpected results.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alex Gibney, Jigsaw Productions, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland

results.title: Big business and the ghost of Confucius
results.creator_credit: Peter Bull, Jigsaw Productions, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, PBI Productions and Teleac Holland
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program looks at the rise of the South East Asian industrial powers of Taiwan, Singapore and South Korea and their rapid rise to the forefront of the world economy. Through portraits and interviews with business leaders and politicians, including Lee Kwan Yew and the chairman of Hyundai, the program grapples with fundamental questions about the role of government in economic growth, and the way rulers and ruled alike have invoked traditional values of loyalty to the state to meet modern economic goals. A study guide and faculty manual are available to accompany this series.
